website_summaries.verdict: Carrying this heavy-duty car seat backpack frees up your hands to keep track of your little one and fits all but the largest carseats.
pros: Backpack carrier with ergonomic, padded harness-style straps
Fully padded with padded interior wings to protect car seat headrest
Protects seat from damage during air travel
cons: Does not fit the Britax Advocate car seat

customer_reviews.title: Won’t strap up on your back correctly
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted to like this. It worked and survived from the time I checked it in until I received it from our final destination. My complaint is... the design on this is horrible. We have nuna infant car seat, weighing 25 lbs with base & seat. The description picture shows that it’s well situated on your back. When in reality, I don’t know how this will actually look or be used as a backpack when the car seat is inside. It didn’t work well for us. Not only did not strap up high enough but was extremely heavy for your back.
customer_reviews.author: zoeyzoey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry your kiddo's giant freakn carseat as you travel
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty construction.. Easy to load the (face it.. Big damn bulky car seat) though the whole thing loaded looks huge it was easy enough to carry thru the airport (even as i had our carry on.. Wheeled bag.. Jackets for me and my 4 yr old.. Her backpack.. And huge stuffed sleep guardian troll.. Mom.. Aka pack mule) it came thruthe four flights we took with no issues keeping our car seat perfect
customer_reviews.author: sharon kate albin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for Maxi Cosi Pria
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use on our recent flights. Our Maxi Cosi Pria seat fit perfectly in this case, and my husband was able to carry it with the backpack straps (the seat is too heavy for me; I had to put it on a cart). As other reviewers suggested, I was able to buckle in a pack of diapers and a small pillow, saving room in my suitcase. Subtracting a star for flimsy zippers (why?? Use better zippers!) and can tend to split if you don't zip slowly and carefully. Overall, a good product, although you'd have to be pretty strong to use the backpack as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t travel without it! Maybe without our toddler but not without this bag!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING! Sturdy straps and zipper. We were able to fit our toddlers convertible seat as well as the base for our infant seat along with diapers and a bag of snacks. We checked this bag at the airport counter and it was so easy for everyone to handle. It is so so so much better than the standard duffle type bags. We bought one of those for the infant seat and wish we had just bought 2 of these instead. I know it’s more expensive than some of the others on here but trust me it’s worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: N Windsor

customer_reviews.title: Okay for infant seat, not sturdy enough for larger car seats.
customer_reviews.text: Nope! We used this bag successfully for our infant car seat, but with the convertible car seat (Britax boulevard) it was such a challenge. It was tricky to get the car seat in, and then once in, the plastic part the backpack strap weaves into snapped as my husband hoisted it onto his back. There really isn’t any other way to carry it, so we went from being very mobile at the airport to me with the baby in the ergo, a backpack on my back and rolling both our large suitcases so my husband could wrangle the stupid car seat in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits the Nuna Rava!
customer_reviews.text: Material is heavy duty, as is the padding inside. My Nuna Rava fit in it perfectly. I was able to throw in bags of diapers on the seat which was nice. Traveled twice so far and couldn’t find any imperfections. Only Con so far is how heavy carrying it as a back pack. Definitely needed a cart.
customer_reviews.author: Jules P.

customer_reviews.title: Big Help
customer_reviews.text: This is the second kind of car seat carrier I've purchased. The quality seemed much better than the previous company I purchased from. However, even after one use; the bottom of the carrier is already showing significant wear. From just one round trip. I like the carrier, really helps with maneuvering around airport; however would wish they made the material stronger in spots that see more stress. Example..the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awkward backpack car seat carrier
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to travel with my little one. Definitely NOT easy by yourself. Don’t get me wrong I am a pretty strong fit woman and to use this is extremely awkward!! You have to fit the car seat in just right or it doesn’t close correctly. It sits on your back way up high so you are off balance (I’m 5’6”). I eventually got my Graco 4-in-1 in the bag and was able to throw in diapers and extra clothes but there was no way I was getting this on my back to carry. I ended up carrying it on my arm or got a bag carrier at the airport.
customer_reviews.author: SCgemini

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag fits our Keyfit 30 perfectly- WITH the base! We've used it on two trips now and checked the car seat at the gate. The materials have held-up perfectly and there's a layer of padding to protect the car seat itself. The only downside is that it's pretty bulky when not in use. The padding is awesome, but it makes a little bulky to carry around before and after the flight. With that said, it fits in the undercarriage of our stroller, so we've been able to make it work! All-in-all I highly recommend this bag to anyone traveling with a car seat!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, practical and works
customer_reviews.text: I was so unsure about this product due to the bad durability reviews. I bought it anyways thinking if it breaks after one flight is going back. Well after 1 international trip to peru (4 flights) my car seat and the bag is in perfect conditions. It is made of a high quality material, enough padding to protect carseat and good shape. It is large enough to fit the car seat plus his winter clothe, 36 cloth diaper and 40 cloth wipe. No complains whatsoever. Now is in storage and will update after my next trip. If it breaks I would blame the airline instead of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, Unusable, Ripped after First Use
customer_reviews.text: This did seem to keep our carswat safe during travel, but the position of the straps is so strange. We have a Britax Marathon Clicktight, and it sat in such a bad position in this bag that it was almost impossible to actually wear as a backpack. It dug into my husband's back so painfully that he ended up just dragging it across the airport. Some wheels at the bottom would have been helpful for that reason. Updated review 11/16/19 Found a 2 inch rip in this after a short 5 hour round trip flight. Not durable and not useable. I'm returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Hancyclopedia

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke off on first flight
customer_reviews.text: This is a great universal bag for travel, we used it for our Nuna infant car seat. Loved that it has back pack straps for easy carrying. Plenty of space and padding. However, I was disappointed to find upon arrival at our destination the very first time using the bag, the zipper broke off. It is expected airlines will be rough on your bags, but this seems a little too soon for something to break.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey E Sapp

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful on a recent air trip
customer_reviews.text: Flying from Virginia to Texas and back with a 2-year old was made easier thanks to this bag. We debated renting a seat from the car rental company, but ultimately we decided to bring our own seat. You can check a car seat at the counter and in many cases the gate at no charge when flying with a child. It's nice to have a seat that you're familiar with when you arrive at your destination. The bag is good quality and it was easy to get our Britax car seat inside. Easy to carry. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K. O'Meara

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this, I thought at the time it was a waist of money. I just wanted to throw the car seats in a plastic bag. He was totally right in purchasing this. This made traveling so much easier with two kids. We were able to fit a normal large car seat plus a backless booster seat in the carrier. It was great that my husband could wear it on his back and free up his hands to carry kids or pull suitcases. I was 28 weeks pregnant at the time and this was a lifesaver. Good quality and durable so far.
customer_reviews.author: S. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable on lower back
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable on lower back at all. I was really expecting more padding after the recommendations, but all I couldfeel was the base of my car seat jabbing me in my lower back. I didn’t even use it because I couldn’t stand 5 mintures of it in the airport. Maybe mine was defective? Everyone seems to review it with a good rating. Dissatisfied for sure.
customer_reviews.author: lipstickmemoirs

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Graco Forever carseat, it fits in well even with the cupholder on! I had a few main concerns, one was how comfortable was this going to be to wear on my back & my partners back. And two, will it last the plane ride. Thankfully it passed both test! The carseat weight was distributed well and was easy to wear for long periods of time (like waiting to check in & waiting for the shuttle). When we landed the bag and the carseat were in perfect condition and on the way back I had the same result
customer_reviews.author: Brianna M. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Protected our car seat (Graco Extend 2Fit)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge, but then again, so are convertible car seats. Our Graco Extend 2Fit fit great with room to spare. I love that we could throw some random stuff that didn’t fit in our suitcase on top of the seat as well. Actually comfortable to carry on your back considering how big and heavy the car seat is. Definitely happy we purchased this for our recent travel.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea M.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: A great product for the price! great idea to have backpack straps (when you are already carrying way way too much!) this was a last minute purchase before a flight and I felt just so much better with the peace of mind that our carseat wouldn't get completely ruined when we gate checked it. so we gate checked the stroller and the carseat- each in their own travel bag and it was easy peasy and we just carried the little guy on to the plane but I was glad we had the stroller in the airport. This bag is a nice thickness and quality (better than most cheap travel bags)
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Product ripped on first use
customer_reviews.text: The product appears to be of decent quality and is well padded in every spot except the zip up flap, which is the part that ripped the first time we checked our car seat for a flight using this bag. I will still probably tape up the ripped spot and continue to use it, but at this price point it should hold up much better than this. There are plenty of cheaper car seat bag options if you're looking for poor quality items that are not durable. If you're looking for something that will stand up to the typical abuse of your average airline baggage handler, this product is unfortunately not it.
customer_reviews.author: V-W-Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Britax marathon carseat
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a flight to put our Britax Marathon in, for safe travels. We checked it at the gate going. But checked it for free with JetBlue. Not sure about other airlines. This is padded. Kept our carseat safe. I didn't want to rent a car seat on our trip w our rental car I preferred using our own that I know. I know it's been I stalled properly and it's clean. I was able to shove some extra items in the seat for travel. Since there was room. Like her toys and diapers/wipes!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Had high hopes!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disappointed with this bag and actually am returning it. While waiting for our bagged after arriving home I was shocked to see that my car seat came out without the bag... the bag eventually came out, however, the zipper was broken. This bag didn't even survive one vacation round trip. Padding is adequate and the backpack option is really great, which is why I'm giving it 2 stars. I have a britax boulevard clicktight which is compatible with this bag.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: We got two of these for a cross country trip with our kids. Each bag fit a Chicco nextfit zip as well as a backless booster seat (placed where the baby would go). The material is very durable. I was worried about trying to carry a giant car seat on my back but the padding in the straps and the bag itself made it more comfortable then I was anticipating. Each bag made it to and from our destination (with layovers) with no rips or tears and our car seat arrived without damage. We will be able to travel with them on a future flight. A very good value!
customer_reviews.author: mountain mama

customer_reviews.title: This bag worked great for a recent trip
customer_reviews.text: This bag worked great for a recent trip. Our Maxi Cosi Pria 85 fit perfectly and, because of the padding, we were comfortable in checking the car seat with no problems. I agree with other reviewers that if you have two car seats, pack one before you leave as it is a tight fit and can be tricky trying to pack up the seat in the parking lot of the airport with a mobile toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Marriage saver
customer_reviews.text: We just about got a divorce in the middle of the airport dragging our Britax Boulevard in the cheap "wheeled" bag from babies r us; so our next adventure I bought this bag. I love that is padded, love the structure to the bag. My husband had just had a back procedure, so we actually bought a little metal luggage cart and bungeed this onto it ... Game changer! It protected our car seat, which our previous bag didn't offer and actually damaged our seat a little. Not this beast! We can even still fit our diaper bag (and probably a few other small items) in this bag last minute at the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Ready

customer_reviews.title: A must have for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Our Evenflo Symphony just barely fits in this...it is a tight squeeze. But overall this product was amazing on our trip to Europe. Imagine carrying a stroller two children and two car seats along for your ride. Being able to place my kids car seat in this backpack style cover made the trip so much easier and say this a lot of money by allowing us to bring our car seat with us to Europe instead of renting the car seat through the rental car company. I had several parents on the trip ask me where I got this item as they also thought it was a fantastic idea. I highly recommend this product to anyone who travels
customer_reviews.author: C James

customer_reviews.title: Takes a beating & still looks good!
customer_reviews.text: The JL Childress car seat carrier is hands-down the best one I’ve purchased. I bought much cheaper ones for half the price and they tore and tattered on the first leg of our family trip last year. I got the Childress in 2019, and not only did it survive a round trip but it took the beating with virtually no wear! Also, you wear this thing like a backpack, so it was really easy for even someone of a smaller frame, like me, to lug around with ease. Can’t say enough about this thing. Def a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: DC Diva Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a 4 star rating because it IS durable. I love the padding and feel less worried about it being tossed around, not too mention the shoulder straps that allow you to wear like a backpack are awesome. However the airline ripped the top handle off like it was a piece of paper on its first trip out. I will be addressing with the airline, but maybe dont check your carseat til gate check because those handlers are rough on luggage for sure
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing travel bag for car seats
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a travel bag for checking our car seat on flights. It is good quality and durable, and my husband (who hates to carry anything) doesn't mind carrying this on his back with the handy backpack straps. Very easy to open and fit a car seat in. We have used it with two different car seats - a Diono Radian rxt, and Diono Monterey booster. It fit easily for both with a little extra room to throw extra soft, light weight items in (like diapers, pull-ups or a small portable training toilet seat). We've already taken it on three round trip flights across the US and it is still in amazing shape. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: ASM

customer_reviews.title: Works Great With Chicco Infant Car Seat
customer_reviews.text: We've traveled with this quite a few times with our Chicco infant car seat. We'll put a few blankets and our coats in there as well and check it under the plane. Its easy to put the seat in there and when our 5 month old moves into a bigger car seat, I have no doubt it will fit well in this carrier too! I will say though, if you do wear this as a backpack, you look rather ridiculous, so get ready for some much needed laughs after traveling with your child.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel  Kmiec

customer_reviews.title: Works with Britax B-Safe 35 Elite and Base
customer_reviews.text: Would've rated 5 stars, but it's not the most comfortable thing to carry through an airport, but it served its purpose and served it well. It protected the car seat (Britax B-Safe 35 Elite and Base) from getting damaged and that was the most important thing. An added benefit is that It's a huge bag and as others have mentioned, you can stuff extra items in there to avoid paying bag fees. We stuffed diapers and wipes in it on the way and dirty clothes on the way back. It withstood all the baggage handlers and baggage claim carousels beautifully. Couldn't ask for much more.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Broke On First Use
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this bag on my first solo flight with my infant son. On the first flight, one of the straps broke...I was able to tie it together in order to use at my destination (although not comfortable at least it worked). On my return flight, the second strap ripped from the bag completely so I had to drag the bag through the airport along with the rest of my stuff (and my son)...not fun! I am very disappointed. Obviously some baggage handlers are more careful than others but the strap should entirely detach in one use! This is not mom approved. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling with baby
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to bring a car seat to New Zealand because we wanted to bring our travel system since we were going with an infant so wanted our own seat and also in case the car seats there weren’t available when we arrived, etc. Checked the bag / carseat all the way through from the desk and i was glad we had this cover - it’s bulky overall but easy to carry and protected our seat. We left the car seat in NZ but bright the bag back because I’m sure we’ll use it. Great for travel with a baby!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda McKinney

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For Travel
customer_reviews.text: This bag made it so much easier for me to carry around my daughter's car seat. I have a Graco Extend 2 Fit and it fit perfectly and there was even some extra space inside. The straps are adjustable and has a little window pocket to include your personal information. I like that the bag completely zips shut unlike other car seat bags that just have a draw string. I used it for two flights and when I returned home there was some damage to the material but it wasn't torn. Overall this makes traveling a lot easier especially if you are on your own!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: After looking around a while I opted for this bag for our Nuna Pipa infant seat. Fit tight but perfectly, and after 4 legs it’s good as new. I was impressed by the quality of the material, the zipper, and the padding. Ticket agent was impressed by it as well and remarked at how silly it is not to cover a checked car seat. I would recommend this to a friend. Update: have used it several times with the nuna pipa and now with our cosco scenera convertible seat we use for travel. This bag is comfortable and keeps the contents secure. I’m glad I made the investment.
customer_reviews.author: MtMuchacha

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great with my Doona
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews that said this wouldn't fit the Doona, but some responses that said it would. I'm here to CONFIRM that this DOES FIT THE DOONA! I love that I can use it to gate check or check my Doona as luggage, if we ever wanted to. The padding was most important to me, as the Doona isn't cheap and I wanted it fully protected even when we gate checked it.
customer_reviews.author: Loving Momma

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy padded bag for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag!! Chicco Keyfit 30 seat and base fit. Made lugging all the baby gear through the airport a breeze. Fairly sturdy, padded. After one flight of gate checking, the bag did show up with one tear near the bottom front. Although not surprised based on how luggage is handled...Held up better than the other 2 thin seat sacks I had ordered. Also, after the seat and base were in the bag I still had room to fit in diapers, formula, winter coats - freed up weight and space in my checked bag without the fees :)
customer_reviews.author: sdog

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! It fits EVERYTHING! And as long as you keep the total weight under 50 lbs... you can use it to tote shoes, additional clothes from all the shopping you did on your trip, extra diapers, toys, etc. And to keep your stuff safe, you can use a small lock to connect the zippers. The book bag carry feature makes it easy to transport!
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Quisumbing

customer_reviews.title: Check that carseat!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is fantastic when traveling with an infant. We check this bag with the car seat inside ( and other things that I couldn't fit into the suitcase) before we go through security. We have traveled 6 times in the past 8 months (12 plane rides) and this bag is holding up great! A former Southwest employee who worked in the baggage area told me these bags are really important to get so the car seats are more protected during the plane ride. Great value, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Tataryn

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag survived the trip we bought it for which consisted of 4 different plane rides. This bag is huge, we where able to fit one Grayco 4-ever car seat and one Grayco click connect infant seat. It was a tight, but they both fit without pulling too hard on the zippers. You will definitely get strange looks wearing this giant bag on your back, but it makes transporting and protecting your expensive car seat easy. The material is sturdy and pretty thick. We didn't have any damage to our car seats and didn't have any rips or tears in the bag itself.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Busch

customer_reviews.title: Best car seat bag I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: Best car seat bag I’ve owned, period. I’ve gone through multiple of the red bags these guys sell and they ultimately get ripped after one or two uses on a plane. This bag is sturdy, fairly comfortable to wear and keeps your car seat safe. My only complaint is that it doesn’t neatly fold down easily. It’s pretty bulky to keep around if you don’t carefully fold it up. We will buy a second for our other seat after a successful trip with this bag.
customer_reviews.author: icecool2

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but bulky
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a flight with our toddler to check his Graco carseat. It was very sturdy and the carseat held up with no damage. The only issue is that it's really bulky, but honestly, you can't really get away from that if you're carrying a full size car seat. It was plenty big, so I was able to pack some of his blankets and a coat in the bag as well (which also provided some extra padding).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A perfect solution for taking a car seat via airline travel
customer_reviews.text: We travelled as a family of 4, taking two car seats and many other bags. Being able to carry them on your back was great on getting them to baggage check. For our 5 year old packed the Britax Marathon Clicktight and as I had some old foam 3" thick I added it under the base for more padding and the Clicktight fitted snuggly inside. For our 1 year old took his Uppababy infant seat and base and added also a little extra foam padding. Both seats survived the return flights. A perfect product for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Jonsku

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was really nervous that this wouldn't fit my car seat because my model wasn't listed on the manufacturers website but i took a chance and it panned out! My husband had to help me zip it the first time because it was a tight squeeze but I actually like that it doesn't have a ton of wiggle room! The shoulder straps made it easier to get the luggage, stroller and kiddo all into the airport (but be careful if you turn around - I almost took out 2 travelers because I forgot I had a LARGE car seat strapped to my back LOL)
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Did not survive first trip as checked luggage
customer_reviews.text: For the price and feel of the product I would have expected it to hold up better, but when we arrived home from our trip this came out of the baggage carousel ripped and torn up. The canvas tore in multiple places, including the zipper and the center of the bag as if it had been punctured in baggage handling. I won't be buying another one, definitely felt this was a waste of money considering it didn't last a single trip as a checked bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Cavalier

customer_reviews.title: Big and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is really big compared to my baby’s car seat, but I know I can use it for a conversion seat too. I also don’t have to fight to squeeze anything inside. The straps are comfy and the pink helps me know it’s mine. I wish it had spinner wheels on it too. This bag is durable and I think I’ll be able to use it for years. I was able to travel with two children (1 infant), a backpack, and a suitcase all by myself
customer_reviews.author: Zed

customer_reviews.title: Fit 2 cosco car seats
customer_reviews.text: We used one of these backpacks for a Cosco Scenera Next and a Cosco Finale. Both car seats tightly fit into one backpack, so we were very satisfied. We gate checked this backpack for two 5 hour flights and the backpack held up well. A friend of ours checked their backpack and it also came back undamaged. Very good product. A lifesaver for flying with carseats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection for Car Seats
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this. The first has held up for our first kid for several trips. We have checked it in at the check in counter, and worn it as a back pack then gate checked it. The latter was perfect when we had a long layover and didn’t want to stay at the airport, but didn’t want to have to wait for it in baggage claims.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Scholar

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but bulky
customer_reviews.text: Please note, this backpack carrier is quite large. It has a lot of padding for your car seat. However, that bolt does not help you once you arrive at your destination and need to also pack a relatively large car seat bag in the vehicle you’re using. If you’re looking for something sturdy and durable, I would recommend it. Please note however, that is going to be bulky.
customer_reviews.author: BWill

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but wouldn't purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: This bag does the job, but if I had it all over to do again I would buy the "Brica Cover Guard Car Seat Travel Tote." Cons: 1.It doesn't have wheels. 2. A panel of padding between the carrier's back and the carseat. The carseat digs into your back and it is very uncomfortable. I would gladly have paid an extra $10 to have a panel of padding/Styrofoam like a laptop pouch. 3. No exterior storage. Other carseat bags have an additional pocket for storage on the anterior of the bag. That would have been ideal. Pros: 1. It protects your carseat from the elements. 2. It is a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Zee

customer_reviews.title: Greatly made
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these to help on on our trip to California and boy let me tell you! My husband carried one and thankfully we had a friend come so he carried the other one while they rolled our bags too and I pushed our double stroller. Game changer to traveling with car seats and now my car seats will also be protected from the abuse they take lol.
customer_reviews.author: JFlo92

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for my Graco extend 2 fit carseat, which is on the bigger side. Makes toting a car seat and a 2 year old a little but easier. My carseat is quite heavy, making carrying the bag on my back less than comfortable. Seems durable and well made compared to cheaper ones available. Lots of extra space inside the bag for pillows or shoes. Definitely a good buy for an occasional traveler.
customer_reviews.author: B Diddy

customer_reviews.title: Does it fit Britax Boulevard??? YES
customer_reviews.text: In past reviews, i couldn't find if this fit our recently purchased Britax Boulevard. These were reviews about the Advocate (similar in size) stating it fit but the zipper busted, barely fit, etc. In the upright position, this fits snug but not overly tight. A little jostling and it's a near perfect fit. We had to recently fly without it and so we just wrapped it in a over-sized plastic bag and checked it at the gate. That worked but the backpack feature is especially nice so you don't have a lug this thing around the airport. It's a two-fer and although cumbersome to carry, at least your hands are free to chase your unruly little explorer.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Peter Peterson

customer_reviews.title: works great for our infant car seat
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for our trip to Maui! It easily fit our Uppa Baby Mesa infant car seat with plenty of additional room to stuff with diapers if needed (the airlines don't check). It's easy to carry as a backpack and it folds down pretty easily for storage. My only complaint is that we came across another family that had the same bag ( as expected with a high selling product on Amazon), so make sure the product is labeled with your name and contact information. I'm not sure how well this will fit when we upgrade to a convertible car seat, but I'm hoping we don't have to buy a new bag. Great bag for the price!
customer_reviews.author: charie putra

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for our Graco carseat
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for our Graco carseat. It was definitely easier to carry it on our backs than to try to hold it in one hand. The weight is somewhat awkward and sits mid back rather than on your hips so it wasn't perfect, but it got the job done. The fabric is thick enough to protect the carseat from minor bumps. The zipper held for our 7 hour flights (including transfers) both ways, but doesn't look super strong. I would purchase again if we needed one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry and durable, fits Graco 3-in-1 booster seat
customer_reviews.text: We used this for a flight from Salt Lake City to Atlanta and it held up really well. We put our child's Graco 3-in-1 Milestones booster seat and had a good bit of room left. We ended up putting soft items in there to pad it and give us extra room in the suitcase. The material is thick and seems very durable. Also, the location of the straps is better than another version of a car seat carrier we have. The straps are lower so it distributes the weight better when wearing it as a backpack. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again. Handle ripped right off
customer_reviews.text: This bag is nicely padded in the shoulders but after two trips, my husband picked it up by the top handle and the handle ripped right off. It only had the car seat in it. I expected it to hold up better and it’s totally inconvenient to have a missing handle at the top for the number of times we have to pick it up during travel.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great for Uppababy Mesa Car Seat
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a recent flight and it was fantastic. I was really impressed with the thick material and the padding. I knew it would protect my Uppababy Mesa car seat. Its also extremely roomy so I stuck in other items that I couldn't fit in my suitcase - stuffed animals, toys etc. I gate checked this bag and the car seat came out without a scratch. I didn't think the backpack feature was a great selling point but BOY WAS I WRONG! My husband carried this on his back and was able to also carry a stroller bag and our carry on while I carried our baby. The fact that it goes on your back is EVERYTHING.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren MB

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality! ripped after 1st use.
customer_reviews.text: This carseat backpack made traveling overseas so much easier with 2 kids. My onky complaint is that the material was worn out after 1 use and there needs to be more padding in the back. My carseat hurt my pack a lot while being carried in the airport. I ordered this carseat bag because it was more expensive and I thought it would last after reading so many bad reviews on other brands. This one did the same thing other people complaimed about even though it was double the price of other ones. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer AB

customer_reviews.title: The padding is good but I didn't carry it for more than 10-15 ...
customer_reviews.text: This car seat backpack saved my life when I went to Seattle with my kids. It was so much easier carrying this backpack around than lugging two car seats around the airport. I was able to put my son's five harness booster seat and my daughter's chicco keyfit 30 car seat (without the base) into this thing. Mind you, it was a little snug but I was still able to zip it without issues. The padding is good but I didn't carry it for more than 10-15 minutes without putting it down, so I can't really comment on long term wearing. I would recommend this to other parents/guardians needing to travel with car seats.
customer_reviews.author: Joi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable, and roomy enough for extras!
customer_reviews.text: Received this carrier/cover today and it’s awesome. Feels very sturdy and is as comfortable as a large car seat on your back can be. We have the Chicco Nextfit car seat and it easily fits. Some reviews said it had to be in a certain position to fit, but I literally popped mine out of the car and straight into the carrier without any difficulty whatsoever. I was then able to put my daughters nebulizer and strap it into the car seat for travel, so that was a huge plus. Bottom line: comfortable enough, sturdy, plenty of room for car seats and any extras!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Reinersman

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Large enough for large car seat.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this was perfect for the car seat and the car base. It is well padded and has heavy duty zippers. Loved the easiness and the quality. The backpack straps are durable and good quality. Has a tag on it for info when traveling via airplane. Really happy with this product as I purchased it for an expensive care seat that’s part of a full stroller system to travel overseas with. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR TRAVEL and fits UppaBaby Mesa Carseat + base
customer_reviews.text: So far, we've used this on one short plane trip. We used it with our Uppababy Mesa Carseat and base. It totally survived the alternative side baggage claim (where they place a "Claim at Gate" tag on your item and toss it into the plane separately from all the luggage check-ins. It was easy to wear as a backpack and did the job we expected it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Have held up using heavy child seats...
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for our two Britax Boulevard Click Tight child seats (which are very heavy) when flying (about 10-12 times) and they have held up great. No rips or tears thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: but the seats are dirty and seems unsafe
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, I never knew about this type of product. I just so happen to come across it when searching for travel products for toddlers. After reading multiple reviews, I decided to purchase it. Usually when we travel, we just rent a car seat from our rental car company, but the seats are dirty and seems unsafe. I live in Hawaii and recently traveled to Disneyland with this product. It was great! We checked it in with the rest of our luggage and it was no charge. It was very easy to carry (as a backpack) and well padded so it was safe from damage. I highly recommend this product for anyone traveling with a car seat!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Lam

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do: protect your car seat, but the trade-off is that the bag is pretty bulky. It's a little hard to manage while walking through the airport with the bag and pushing your stroller at the same time, as I have a bag for the infant car seat as well as the stroller base. I've been tempted to check my car seat and stroller before security to not have to deal with the bags, which defeats the point of gate check. But, if it is raining, it does prevent your car seat from getting sopping wet. So, it's a good product but could be better if it was lighter and more compact.
customer_reviews.author: VivianL

customer_reviews.title: good, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two options for an upcoming trip to compare and make sure they fit our carseat. This one was solidly constructed and big enough for the Graco 4ever carseat. However, we ended up going with the ZOHZO Car Seat Travel Bag (same price) instead for the following reasons: had the hard button protectors on the bottom (vs just fabric on this bag), the ZOHZO had a self-contained storage holdup solution (vs this bag had a totally separate velcro piece that would almost certainly get lost), and the ZOHZO had more structure/better zipper situation. This isn't a bad bag by any means, we just liked the ZOHZO better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Very thick fabric! Has fit our maxi cosi infant seat and also our bigger Nuna rava! Great for traveling with larger seats! Has held up through about 15 trips so far! Only downfall is everyone seems to have this bag so I’ve had to mark it with bright ribbon so someone else doesn’t take the wrong seat! Overall, very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Do not Purchase.  Straps not sturdy.  Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I don’t travel much, but when I do, I need something dependable. I liked the padded protection the bag provided, however the best feature was a disappointment. The shoulder straps became detached the first time it was checked at the airport. The second time the strap came off completely. We have a small child and need our hands, so the ergonomic design, and desire for hands free drew us to the product. We are her dissatisfied, and more-so because I believe we are past the return window.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: You are throwing your money away on any other car seat bag
customer_reviews.text: Frequent travelers here, excellent bags just wish we found sooner! After countless ripped red bags and other inferior car seat bags being destroyed after a single trip we finally found these awesome bags. They are far easier to travel with (we have two in convertible car seats at the moment), much more durable and protective. Don’t waste your money buying another bag just to have to throw away after one trip. We have gone on atleast 8 flights with these and still look new. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: A good padded but not too bulky car seat bag for traveling. The backpack straps make it much easier to carry then a previous over the shoulder bag we owned. Keeps the car seat safe and enough room to put a couple of other items. The only thing is I wish the straps were a little higher on the seat cover but overall a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel AND being right
customer_reviews.text: When this ginormous hunk of canvas arrived on my doorstep, my husband thought I was nuts for getting a backpack carseat cover and said, literally, "Who the @#%@ is going to wear that on their back?" By the end of our cross-country flight with a 2 year old, he was so incredibly grateful for those backpack straps that he apologized and vowed to never question my travel planning superiority again :)
customer_reviews.author: A. Letzring

customer_reviews.title: SO disappointed. Used for ONE trip.
customer_reviews.text: SO disappointed. It lasted one and a half flights. I bought two and one tore after the first flight. The other completely ripped apart from the zipper from the second flight. It came out of the baggage claim completely undone and the car seat completely visible which is how I knew it was ours. All of our other bags were fine so I'm not sure if it was a handling problem but you would think the bag would be sturdy enough to handle some banging around!! The bag is no longer usable and I was only able to use it for one trip!! Such a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for travel
customer_reviews.text: We have a Chicco keyfit 360 carseat, which fits perfectly inside here. I have traveled alone with my infant daughter, and idk what I would have done without this. I wore her in a carrier and had this on my back, and then had both hands free to navigate the airport. When I arrived back home from my trip and picked up the car seat, the bag was really dirty. I'm glad it was on the bag and not my actual car seat, which would be much more difficult to clean!
customer_reviews.author: caterpillarkiller

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have three of these bags for all of the car seat transporting we do with our kiddos. They work well and protect your car seat investment. We’ve used the bag to check a car seat at the ticket counter and at gate check, it held up well in both instances. We fit a recaro convertible car seat in this bag and a Nuna infant seat with the base (separate trip).
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. It is super durable and it fit my son's massive carseat. My 1 year old and I went on a few flights for vacation. It was just us 2. This bag is also a backpack. I was able to push the stroller, drag the suitcase and put the car seat on my back. It made life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Henley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag. Flies free.
customer_reviews.text: We flew with twins and took our car seats. The car seats were expensive so I wanted to protect them and gave these a shot. They were perfect. Your car seats can fly free with you if you didn’t know. And there was room for us to stuff in toys and diapers. You will look and feel completely ridiculous wearing this through an airport because of the size. And I had two. Also be careful because you’ll knock people easily too.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Mason

customer_reviews.title: Protects car seat well. Easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this backpack for many trips. It works very well in securing our preferred travel car seat (cosco scenera and then, the evenflo for older kids). It protects the car seat well and we haven’t had any tears. I am petite and don’t have any trouble using it as a backpack. I don’t recommend stuffing loose items into the backpack because you have to take them out when securing the car seat after you reach your destination. It’s just a big hassle.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Simple but useful bag for travel
customer_reviews.text: We used this bag together with the J.L. Childress umbrella stroller bag to travel with our infant car seat and carrier. The carseat bag is huge - easily fit our infant car seat, base, and then some. It's not the prettiest bag in the world, but it's sturdy and doesn't add much weight when traveling. Very glad we had it to protect our carseat, and also nice that we will be able to use it with our convertible carseat as well. It does come with a small strap to keep it folded up when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: In LA

customer_reviews.title: Great hands free option
customer_reviews.text: We own 2 of these. Good hands free option for traveling bc you can wear it on your back. Yes it’s heavy on your back with a toddler seat in it but worth it to have hands free to push stroller, wheel luggage, chase toddler. Padded well for your back and to protect seat. They fold up pretty compact when not in use. We have used it with a britax b safe infant seat and britax click tight toddler seat- both fit easily. We have flown with at least one probably 7 times and never had any issues
customer_reviews.author: Laura S

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for traveling, one less thing to carry in our hands. It looks gigantic on our backs though. I'm only 4'11" and it looks ridiculous on me. My husband, whom I force to wear, is 6'1 and it still looks a little silly on him. But we don't care. We've used it many times in airports with shuttles and rental cars. We've even stuffed extra clothes in there when we've gone over our luggage weight limit.
customer_reviews.author: Amy K.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to add diapers and wipes if checking!
customer_reviews.text: Love this for travel. It has enough room to fit the car seat and lots of diapers and wipes—the best part, car seats check for free in this bag, and so I was able to also pack plenty of baby supplies in this bag, as well. It is really large, and dwarfed my 5’4” frame, but other than looking ridiculous, it was very easy to carry on my back, freeing up my hands. The bag has some padding to help protect the seat of checking it. A little steep on the price, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Elidaisy

customer_reviews.title: Durable, well-made bag
customer_reviews.text: Been on three flights over the past few months and this bag holds up very well. Still looks like new. The material is a strong, durable canvas and the zipper is more heavy duty. Plenty big enough to fit our Chicco key fit car seat and base, as well as other things we stuff in there. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits Uppa Baby Cruze and Base!
customer_reviews.text: Very robust! Thick zipper means it won't bust open, seems air tight also once closed. The fabric is thick and strong. There is padding inside to protect the seats. This fits our Uppa Baby Cruze plus Base plus we put all of our winter jackets we were traveling with inside too. The only thing I wish it did was fold up or roll up smaller. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MrFunk

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Zipper.
customer_reviews.text: This bag was used 3 times. As an amazon prime customer I am extremely disappointed that they could not help me with this problem. They simply offered me a $5 credit. When I spend $40 on a bag I would assume that if there is a problem within a few months of using it they would back up their product! I am extremely disappointed! If JL Childress is to fix this problem I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: big dog

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bag
customer_reviews.text: Friend recommended this bag and I am so glad I took her advice. The bag will fit nearly any size in style car seat. We used it for both an uppababy infant car seat and Gracco Extend to Fitt. It was easy to carry, easy to travel and easy to store. Honestly no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Always Amazoning

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive option
customer_reviews.text: We have the uppa baby car seat and this travel bag worked great! We were very concerned as we were traveling internationally and did not want our car seat to be ruined. It kept it safe and was not too bulky either. It is also MUCH less than the uppa baby travel option. We were very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Cheap yet sturdy and easy to use. I didn't buy the bag from manufacturer of my car seat because this was way cheaper and I'm so glad I got this. My infant car seat fit and the bigger one when he grows will fit too. Great price, folds up easily, protected the seat, easy to carry on my pack when you have 100 other baby things and the material was sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: BGCritic

customer_reviews.title: Looks durable and well made.
customer_reviews.text: I havent actually tried this and had to return it because I'm no longer taking the carseat with me, but it arrived in time, it looks durable and very cushny/well padded from the bottom and fit my chico fit 2 carseat with base with heaps of room to spare! And my baby's carseat is heavy and bulky. I will definitely buy it again in the future if I needed a carseat bag and look forword to trying it then. I wish it had 4 wheels though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I bought this before a recent family vacation
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this before a recent family vacation. It fit our Britax Boulevard carseat perfectly, and there was also extra room to pack a couple items with it. I thought the bag was well made and well padded. We checked the carseat on our trip, and it arrived at our destination without a scratch, even after two connections. My husband wore it as a backpack to and from the car, and had no problems handling two giant roller bags as well. It would be nice if this also had some wheels so you had the option to tow it, and it is a little bulky to store, but overall it served its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: eps2006

customer_reviews.title: What we needed.
customer_reviews.text: No damage from being checked to our Chicco NextFit Zip. It’s padded and allows for more stuff to be packed with it. Just fair warning, since we packed clothes in it, they gave us a bit of heck since it wasn’t just the car seat—but that was only in Denver on American. Traveled just fine doing that elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Linsie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This was used for our Britax convertible car seat flying cross country. The car seat fit well and was easy to get in the back pack. It did feel a bit awkward when put on but it held up really well and was a lot easier to manage than the cheap one I had had from Southwest Airlines. Would very much recommend and would buy another for multiple car seats. Quality seems really good so far but have only used it twice.
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: This DOES fit the Britax Pinnacle 90-ClickTight!!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this bag after reading mixed reviews saying that it did or didn't fit the super huge Britax Pinnacle 90. Guess what?? It DOES fit...and very well I might add! Make sure you lower the headrest all the way, and recline the back to the upright position, and voila! It fits with no issues at all. It is a very durable material as well. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: great bag, no problems and easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: This bag was great! I wish I bought it four years ago for car seats over the last few years, but I'll still use it for a booster seat when traveling for a long time. The Britax car seat fits in great, it's easy to wear, although be careful when turning around because I almost took my kid out a few times. It's a very popular case so make sure you check ID on it before leaving the baggage area at the airport. You can insert your info into the little plastic area at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Reb

customer_reviews.title: Junk and waste of money! Won’t last a trip
customer_reviews.text: Got this and it didn’t even last a one way trip. Not sure how to contact the seller to get the replacement. Have some photos attached to show the damage caused in first trip itself. To be honest this is not required bcoz we can just send the car seat without any cover and won’t cause any issues like this. This is unnecessarily and total waste of money. Bought this bcoz of amazon choice and now I should not trust amazon choice anymore. Junk and total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Gopa

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have if You're Flying With a Car Seat
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's a huge bag, but that's the point. We used this with our Graco SnugRide Click Connect 35 carseat and the base and it fit fit, with some room to spare. We threw in some toys and jackets that didn't fit in our carry-ons. We gate-checked this without any problems on an American Airlines flight. I say it's a must-have for anyone who will be traveling with their carseat.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N.

customer_reviews.title: Good for lighter infant style seats.  Not quite sturdy enough for larger convertibles.
customer_reviews.text: We've flown with this bag on 8 occasions and have always checked it at the main desk rather than at the gate. The first few were with an infant car seat and base and the last 4 with a britax convertible seat (much heavier). It held up fine until the 7th flight when the plastic strap adjuster broke. The seams are fraying where the straps attach to the top of the bag. I was hoping to be able to store extra diapers in the seat, but we don't because we are afraid the straps will come off entirely.
customer_reviews.author: HDTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: close strap needs to be attached!!
customer_reviews.text: great and sturdy for travel but the strap to close bag when not in use isn't attached. as a parent w a kid who is still using a car sea i don't need to tell you that i have enough luggage to deal with, i don't need one more thing loose to try and remember not to lose. big design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie H.

customer_reviews.title: Great cover!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I had bought another one but ended up being too flimsy. This one provides padding and more structure so better protection. Car seats aren’t cheap and this does the job to protect it. It’s great there are straps so my husband can carry it on his back like a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Travel essential
customer_reviews.text: This really helped keep our piece of mind with traveling with an infant for the first time by keeping the integrity of our car seat. It is an extremely sturdy and well made product. I just wished it was easier to fold up for storing purposes. This is a must when traveling with any infant! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price to protect the car seat
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by the quality. It fit my Uppababy Mesa infant car seat plus some packing cubes and diapers for the baby. It shielded the contents from the rough hands of the airline luggage handlers well. We had no issues with the airline accepting it as a free checked piece for the baby.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Kroy

product_meta.title: J.L. Childress Ultimate Backpack Padded Car Seat Travel Bag, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackCarrying convenience, comfort, and choices! The Ultimate Car Seat Travel Bag allows families to protect their child's car seat when traveling. The Ultimate is the only car seat travel bag available that offers thick padding on all sides, padded interior wings and a custom fit to ensure protection of your car seats' safety features. The ergonomic, harness-style backpack straps are fully padded, providing a comfortable, hands-free carrying option for luggage-burdened parents. Convenient webbing handle and dual zipper opening make it easy to put in and take out your car seat. The Ultimate also features an ID card and clear ID card pocket and is made of heavy-duty fabric for durability and easy care.Product Care: Wipe clean with water and mild soap. When traveling with an infant car seat, detach the base and place it on top of the car seat inside the bag.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
With all-around padding, padded interior wings and a custom fit to ensure protection of the car seat's safety features, the Ultimate Car Seat Travel Bag from J.L. Childress lets you comfortably carry and protect your child's car seat while keeping your hands free for other luggage. Extra-tall to fit most popular styles, this bag includes an ID pocket with ID card and dual lockable zippers. Water-resistant, heavy-duty fabric cleans easily and protects car seat from moisture. Features padded, adjustable backpack straps for carrying comfort.
feature_bullets: Padding protects your car seat's safety features and backpack straps allow you to carry your car seat hands-free. Airline certified. Material is made of polyester
To ensure that this item fits your car seat, check the compatibility chart in the Technical Specification section below (click on User Manual)
Fully padded with padded interior wings to protect car seat headrest ; Ergonomic, harness-style backpack straps are padded and adjustable

Dual, lockable zipper opening ; Durable construction using water resistant and easy to clean materials. TIPS- When traveling with an infant car seat, detach the base and place it on top of the car seat inside the bag. Additionally, utilize the extra space in the bag for packing diapers, towels, clothing and more as most airlines allow you to check your car seat for free

Brought to you by J.L. Childress, the worldwide leading brand in universal car seat and stroller travel bags. From our family to yours, Travel Happy! #travelhappy #jlchildress #familytravel; Adult use only.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,348 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
